message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: The java.util.ConcurrentModificationException occurs when a collection is modified while it is being iterated over. This can happen if you try to add or remove elements from a HashMap while iterating over it using an iterator. To avoid this exception, you can use the Iterator's remove() method to remove elements from the HashMap instead of using the HashMap's remove() method. Here's an example:

Iterator<Map.Entry<String, String>> iterator = hashMap.entrySet().iterator();
while (iterator.hasNext()) {
    Map.Entry<String, String> entry = iterator.next();
    if (condition) {
        iterator.remove(); // Use the iterator's remove() method
    }
}

<<<explanation>>>: In the given exception stack trace, it seems that the ConcurrentModificationException is occurring in the net.sf.json.JSONObject library. This means that the library is trying to modify a HashMap while iterating over it, which is not allowed. To fix this issue, you can try using the iterator's remove() method instead of modifying the HashMap directly.
